Subject: Participate in Thesis Survey and/or Interview- Multiracial Identity

I'm a Pitzer senior looking for participants in my senior thesis on multiracial identity. If you're multiracial and 18+,  you're eligible! It involves a survey and/or an interview. The survey is remote (0.5 research credits + Creme gift card raffle) and the interview is in person at Pitzer (1 research credit + Creme gift card). You can contact me or my advisors (darin_brown@pitzer.edu, jessica_kizer@pitzer.edu) with any questions.

Email me at nbasu@students.pitzer.edu if you want to participate!
\Terminate\
Subject: The QSC is here to support you!

The QSC is open for one on one help with courses including: biology, chemistry, computer science, economics, math and statistics, neuroscience, physics, and any course with a quantitative component!

Appointments with our QSC Partners are available at: pomona.mywconline.com

For help with courses not on our schedule, general support, data analysis, or for consultations on quantitative research projects or theses please email us at qsc@pomona.edu.

\Terminate\
Subject: English Department Event 2/29 Toby Altman Poetry Reading 2/29

Please join the English Department for a reading by early career poet and scholar of Renaissance literature, Toby Altman, from his new book Discipline Park in the Ena Thompson Room 108 of Crookshank on Thursday 2/29 at 4:30.  His book manuscript, entitled Diachronic Renaissance: Periodization, Poetics, and The Shock of the Old, traces "subterranean connections between Renaissance and avant-garde poetics."  Think of it as an intellectual genealogy for his own practices as a poet!

Subject: Health Bridges - Abortion and the Supreme Court with Jaclyn Serpico

Join us for an enlightening discussion with Jaclyn Serpico, a trailblazing Fellow at UCLA School of Law Center on Reproductive Health, Law, and Policy. With expertise in reproductive justice, health, and rights, Jaclyn's insights on medication abortion and contraception access are invaluable. In her talk "Abortion and the Supreme Court" she will bring up many relevant issues and topics throughout the US today.

RSVP now for an engaging event: http://tinyurl.com/HBJaclynSerpico

Subject: Open Academy - Teatime Discussion at the CMC Athenaeum

 "The Suburban Crisis: White America and the War on Drugs"

Join Matthew Lassiter, professor of history at the University of Michigan, for a casual discussion about the politics of drug policy as it has differed between predominantly white suburban communities and predominantly minority urban communities. This event is sponsored by the Open Academy at CMC, and will run from 3:15-4:30 at the courtyard of the CMC Athenaeum. Refreshments will be available!

Subject: Sustainability Office - Sustainable fashion show at the Benton

Join us on February 29th from 7-9 pm at the Benton Museum of Art for the Freeroom's annual sustainable fashion show. This year's theme is "Conscious couture: stories of slow fashion," which aims to rejuvenate the runway by showcasing student designs made entirely from secondhand material, ranging from Free Room-sourced fabric to thrift store beads. We hope you join us for a spectacular evening at the Benton where walking art and the hopeful future of fashion will be on display!

Subject: Health Bridges and the Pomona Student Union - Resiliency In The Flesh: Building Trans Power During Adversity
Join us for a lunchtime lecture on February 2nd from 12:15-1:00 pm in Rose Hills Theater with Bamby Salcedo! Bamby will speak as part of the Power Series and Gender and Health Series. Bamby has brought more visibility to the intersectional identities and stories of LGBTQ+, Latinx, youth, migrant, and incarcerated identities. "Resiliency In The Flesh" will offer lessons on strength and power amidst adversity in the transgender community and beyond!

\Terminate\
Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents: Tish Harrison Warren on the Texture of Joy
This Thurs, Feb 1  |  7 p.m.  |  Rose Hills Theatre
Join the Humanities Studio as we welcome Anglican priest, author, and New York Times contributor Tish Harrison Warren for a conversation about "The Texture of Joy." Harrison will explore what joy is (and isn't), what poets and thinkers have told us about the meaning of joy, and the relationship between grief/suffering and joy. It's the fourth event in our 2023-2024 Joy Speakers Series. Learn more at bit.ly/joyatpomona
\Terminate\
Subject: Humanities Toolkit Session: Opinion Writing Workshop with NYT Editor Teresa Tritch
Wed, Feb 1 / 1-4pm / SCC 201 (Hart Room)
The Humanities Studio invites students to join us for an opinion writing workshop with editor and writer Teresa Tritch. Drawing on 13 years of experience as a member of the Editorial Board of the New York Times, Tritch will address how academics can write persuasively for a broad audience, what editors are looking for, how to gain an editor's attention and how to write an effective op-ed. Register & learn more at bit.ly/opedwithtritch

Thurs, Feb 1  |  7 p.m.  |  Rose Hills Theatre
Join the Humanities Studio as we welcome Anglican priest, author, and New York Times contributor Tish Harrison Warren for a conversation about ""The Texture of Joy."" Harrison will explore what joy is (and isn't), what poets and thinkers have told us about the meaning of joy, and the relationship between grief, suffering and joy. It's the fourth event in our 2023-2024 Joy Speakers Series.
\Terminate\
Subject: The Humanities Toolkit Session: Opinion Writing Workshop with Teresa Tritch
Wed, Feb 1 / 1-4pm / SCC 201 (Hart Room)
The Humanities Studio invites students to join us for an opinion writing workshop with editor and writer Teresa Tritch. Drawing on 13 years of experience as a member of the Editorial Board of the New York Times, Tritch will address how academics can write persuasively for a broad audience, what editors are looking for, how to gain an editor's attention and how to write an effective op-ed. Register & learn more at bit.ly/opedwithtritch

Join us as we unpack these questions and more in the first installment of the Presidential dialogues Initiative. Reception immediately following.

Subject: Passionate about addressing food insecurity in the community and reducing food waste?
The mission of the Food Recovery Network is to deliver food leftovers from the on-campus dining halls to local community partners. Volunteers operate in teams of two, one driver and one handler. No driver's license is needed to be a handler.
If interested please complete this form.

Information session is January 30th 7-8 pm at the Draper Center (735 Dartmouth Avenue) for new volunteers, bring driver's license.

Subject: Every Vote Counts Claremont  -  Voter Education Office Hours!
Happy National Voter Education Week Pomona!! Tonight we will be stopping by Pomona and posted on Frary's steps! Our office hours are a one-stop shop for the voting process and we can help you with any step of voting. We are here to answer any voting or election questions, and provide resources to make sure you are #VoteReady! All we ask is for you to please remember to bring your driver's license and know your social security number (some states require both).

Subject: Come volunteer with STEP (Saturday Tongan Education Program)!

Are you interested in tutoring and connecting with communities outside Claremont? The Saturday Tongan Education Program (STEP) connects 5C student volunteers with the Inland Empire Tongan community, & fosters growth in local Tongan youth by providing academic tutoring, cultural activities, and other resources every Saturday. For the first time in 2 years, STEP will be back in-person at Walker Lounge THIS SATURDAY on 10/8 from 10 am to 12 pm!
Here's the link to sign up:  tinyurl.com/stepform22
\Terminate\
Subject: Looking for new ways to address harm at the 5Cs?

As students from the Prison, Punishment and Redemption class, we are planning a workshop to engage and help reform our college communities through restorative justice. We wanted to reach out and see what our community would be interested in being taught and actually want to attend. Would you like to learn how to better address conflict in your relationships? Skill up on how to apologize and be accountable to your communities?

Fill out this anonymous survey! https://tinyurl.com/pprjustice<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fpprjustice&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7C6a3fe6a0ac3b47edc9ae08daa55f59b3%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C638004126187472747%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=l58xQoWEZfHsdhWjisd24wNAsCQYMNvVNAIeV%2BB2V3c%3D&reserved=0>
\Terminate\
Subject: Donate to a local Women and Youth Empowerment Fund in DR Congo (started by PZ alum)

DR Congo has more than 2.8 million women and 1.6 million children in internal displacement. In 2022 alone, the province of North Kivu (in the Eastern Region) recorded more than 1 million internal displacements due to armed conflicts. Juliette Bwira Bulenda, the founder of Women and Youth Empowerment Association (WEA) in DR Congo is fundraising to provide housing, healthcare, and education to displaced women and children in DR Congo. Consider donating what you can to help!

Subject: Participate in an HCI study and receive $15!
The Pomona Human Computer Interaction Lab is running a study on collaborative art, and we are recruiting participants. If you are over the age of 18, have normal vision without glasses (contacts are fine, though!), do not have a history of epilepsy, and would be comfortable with drawing together with another participant (no art experience needed!), sign up to participate in the study at this link: http://bit.ly/hci-draw<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Fhci-draw&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7C9a6b1cb575334924b45208daa241f8f2%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C638000701472721172%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=zPVmSby9H9jw8lolbugHjqiQxj3BVtV%2ByblDZlwTjr8%3D&reserved=0> .

If you are over the age of 18, have normal vision without glasses (contacts are fine, though!), do not have a history of epilepsy, and would be comfortable with drawing together with another participant (no art experience needed!), sign up to participate in the study at this link: http://bit.ly/hci-draw<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Fhci-draw&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cafdb005e00e340b0c77d08da9fdeca8a%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637998076478935911%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Qc%2BXfeVNL6m6TCM8vCkojpXVV3UW5eobGkZdROHZUB0%3D&reserved=0> . Compensation is $15 and the study is expected to last 1 hour.

Subject: Mental Illness Education and MIND Lab Attitudes Study

Want to learn about schizophrenia? Recruiting participants for MIND Lab study! If you are interested, you can contact this email: mindlab@pomona.edu<mailto:mindlab@pomona.edu> If you are a Pomona Intro Psych Student, sign up on SONA. Cannot participate if you have taken or are taking an upper-level psychology course (anything beyond Intro Psych). Participants can receive $20-$30 in compensation or 2 research credits for Intro Psych and up to $10.

Subject: Hong Kong exiled activist Speakers Event THIS THURS

Sunny Cheung is an activist living in exile following the Chinese Communist Party's crackdown in Hong Kong. In 2019, he testified before Congress ahead of the passing of the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act. Sunny will speak on the relationship between the Hong Kong democratic movement and modern US-Sino competition.

This Thurs, Sept 29 / 4:30pm / Estella, Rm 1051

Subject: The Humanities Studio Toolkit Session:  Applying to Grad Programs in the Humanities

Mon, Oct 3 | 4:30pm | Ena Thompson Room, Crookshank

Join us for a practical roundtable with three UCLA graduate advisors dealing with such topics as making the decision to go to graduate school; selecting the right school; the importance of contacting potential faculty advisors; crafting a personal statement, statement of purpose, and/or diversity statement; selecting and polishing a writing sample; approaching letter writers; and funding your graduate education. Refreshments served.

Subject: Hiring for consultants!
Claremont Sustainability Consulting is the first and only environmental consulting club at the 5Cs. We help major companies, local businesses, and other entities create sustainability strategies, evaluate financial and technical feasibility of green initiatives, and support KPI establishment and tracking. We are recruiting driven 5C students interested in sustainability and the environmental to apply!

Deadline: Friday, September 23rd (11:59pm)

Subject: Nancy Um; Associate Director for Research and Knowledge Creation, Getty Research Institute
In this talk, Prof. Um will consider the rise of Indian Ocean art history as a vibrant area of study that productively forges visual and material connections across the eastern and southern hemispheres, while also positing objects as fundamental sources for the writing of oceanic histories.


Co-sponsored by the Departments of Art History, History and Middle East Studies/Asian Studies at Pomona College

Subject: Participate in an HCI study and receive $15!

The Pomona Human Computer Interaction Lab is running a study on collaborative art, and we are recruiting participants. If you are over the age of 18, have normal vision without glasses (contacts are fine, though!), do not have a history of epilepsy, and would be comfortable with drawing together with another participant (no art experience needed!), sign up to participate in the study at this link: bit.ly/hci-draw . Compensation is $15 and the study is expected to last 1 hour.

Subject: Interested in Entrepreneurship?

Pomona Ventures is a start-up ecosystem where students learn from founders, support founders, & find their co-founders. PV provides resources and workshops for students and hosts Sage Tank, a pitch competition for 5C student founders. If you are interested in startups, product design, VC, or tech, PV is the place for you. All majors and backgrounds welcome!

Follow us on instagram @pomonaventures

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents: Julian Aguon on Indigenous Rights & Environmental Justice

Thurs, Sept 29 / 4:30pm / Estella, Rm 1051
Join the Humanities Studio as we kick off our 2022-23 Human|Nature Speakers Series with a talk and reading from human-rights lawyer and writer Julian Aguon. Aguon will read from his acclaimed new book "No Country for 8-Spot Butterflies" and talk about its geopolitical context and how it calls for justice-for everyone, and for Indigenous peoples in particular. Q&A follows. https://bit.ly/hshumnat<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Fhshumnat&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cb422c4c8e19d4b00846708da9a62edae%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637992046921458989%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2FknvyXF8KN%2FzWzwBUcCdqDFKEqZyFZgZuxIFP7rRxFk%3D&reserved=0>
\Terminate\
Subject: The Humanities Studio Toolkit Session:  Applying to Grad Programs in the Humanities

Mon, Oct 3 | 4:30pm | Ena Thompson Room, Crookshank
Join us for a practical roundtable with three UCLA graduate advisors dealing with such topics as making the decision to go to graduate school; selecting the right school; the importance of contacting potential faculty advisors; crafting a personal statement, statement of purpose, and/or diversity statement; selecting and polishing a writing sample; approaching letter writers; and funding your graduate education. Refreshments served.

Subject: Join Pomona Consulting Group (PCG) as an Associate Consultant!

Applications to join PCG's Associate Consultant (AC) Program close this FRIDAY at 11:59pm.
The AC Program is a rewarding five-week sprint designed to introduce students to the world of consulting. At the end, you will get the chance to service a real-world client. NO prior experience is necessary, just an enthusiasm to explore the field!
\Terminate\
Subject: Nancy Um -Early Modern Object Itineraries: Diplomacy and Trade across and in the Indian Ocean


Co-sponsored by the Departments of Art History and History at Pomona College
Prof. Um will consider the rise of Indian Ocean art history as a vibrant area of study that productively forges visual and material connections across the eastern and southern hemispheres, while also positing objects as fundamental sources for the writing of oceanic histories.

Subject: Join the Equity in the Environment Program!
Are you a first or second-year student interested in ecology, geology, and/or the environment? Are you an underrepresented student? If so, you are invited to apply to a program run through the Quantitative Skills Center- Equity in the Environment! Through bi-monthly meetings, we help equip students for further studies and careers in these disciplines. You do NOT have to be a declared major to apply!

Subject: Join 5C Science Bus!

Do you enjoy working with kids? Are you looking for a meaningful, in-person way to give back to the community?
If so, consider becoming a Science Bus volunteer! Volunteers lead interactive science lessons and experiments covering everything from astronomy to forensics! You can teach either Thursdays or Fridays from 1-3pm; the lesson plan, materials, and transportation are provided. (Plus, we offer free boba/coffee after each lesson!)

\Terminate\
Subject: Matriculate Advising Fellow Applications are open - apply by 9/19!

Matriculate is a college access non-profit that supports high-achieving, low/moderate-income high school students to apply and enroll in a best-fit college by pairing students with Advising Fellows, who serve as mentors through the college application process. Matriculate provides the training and support needed to support students virtually and learn about college access. We are currently recruiting students to serve as Advising Fellows at Pomona!
\Terminate\
Subject: Matriculate Advising Fellow Applications are open - apply by 9/19!

Matriculate is a college access non-profit that supports high-achieving, low/moderate-income high school students to apply and enroll in a best-fit college by pairing students with Advising Fellows, who serve as mentors through the college application process. Matriculate provides the training and support needed to support students virtually and learn about college access. We are currently recruiting students to serve as Advising Fellows at Pomona!
Apply at https://bit.ly/3B8YUtz by 9/19!

Subject: Join the Equity in the Environment Program!

Are you a first or second-year student interested in ecology, geology, and/or the environment? Are you an underrepresented student? If so, you are invited to apply to a program run through the Quantitative Skills Center- Equity in the Environment! Through bi-monthly meetings, we help equip students for further studies and careers in these disciplines. You do NOT have to be a declared major to apply!
To learn more and apply, fill out this google form: https://forms.gle/Ah53TJWcxWkeSA5z8

Please only sign up for one slot, and keep in mind that callbacks will take place the day after auditions, on Sunday, September 18th. We are incredibly excited to meet and hear you all!

Subject: Join the Arab Students Association!

The Arab Students Association (ASA) is a 7Cs organization committed to promoting cultural appreciation and political cognizance for Arab countries and cultures. While the club is geared to Arab and MENA students, meetings and events are open to people of all ethnic identities.
Join the club on Engage: https://claremont.campuslabs.com/engage/organization/asa
Follow our Instagram for updates on meetings and events: https://www.instagram.com/7csarabstudentsassociation/<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2F7csarabstudentsassociation%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7C258b1aa54dce4f57b15308da94de0ba1%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637985978633691253%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NyFoPjUDmLcqI4pK4F8So5KWPhro6PaQH59WJFAKHe4%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Calling All Actors, Dancers and Singers for Head Over Heels Auditions!
When a soothsayer foretells the downfall of Arcadia, the King goes on a quest to avoid his fate. A 16th century love story to the tune of the Go-Go's. "Head Over Heels" is a hilarious modern-day fairytale told through pop-punk music and posh prose. Centering queer love, mistaken identities, changing social norms, and iconic songs, "Head Over Heels" is a feel-good romp that celebrates the joy of acceptance and community.
\Terminate\
Subject: Intimacy & Consent Workshop Opportunity
Calling all theatre nerds! Come to our department-sponsored intimacy workshop, this Friday from 1-4pm in the Large studio of Seaver Theatre. Learn how to navigate modern practices around consent and performance from professional Intimacy Coordinator Carly D.W. Bones. Majors, minors, and those involved in student theatre must make every effort to attend.

Make sure you're following @5CperformingArts on Instagram to stay up to date.

Subject: Neuroscience Department   -   Neuroscience Liaison Applications
The Neuroscience department is currently soliciting liaison applications from juniors within our major. Liaisons occupy a unique place within our Neuro community. As a Liaison, you will represent the Neuro Major among students with undeclared majors who are actively seeking information about the department and develop and create community-building opportunities.

Email Christine.Schabow@pomona.edu<mailto:Christine.Schabow@pomona.edu> for a copy of the application (due end of day Friday, September 9, 2022)
\Terminate\
Subject: SAGEHEN CAPITAL MANAGEMENT   -   Join Sagehen Capital Management!
Calling all students wanting to learn about investing and the world of finance! Sagehen Capital Management is Pomona's student-run hedge fund that manages ~$1 million of the endowment. Starting the week of 9/12, SCM is excited to launch our 6-week educational segment diving into the basic principles of investing and valuation. No prior knowledge or experience is required!

Feel free to apply here: https://forms.gle/Um3YV7BjzLftRdTz6<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FUm3YV7BjzLftRdTz6&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Caea9d7296adf4543a7fe08da91c2169c%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637982560026503351%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=3kjRBtoARL5d9%2F553GkIWTUvWFKcOdaSVbVkkxup6LE%3D&reserved=0> (SCM is a non-competitive club)

Subject: International and Domestic Programs   -   CMC Washington Program for Spring 2023
Students in the Washington Program spend either the semester in the capital of the United States working at a full-time internship, taking two seminar courses, and conducting an Independent Research Project. The deadline for Spring 2023 is September 18, 2022.


Davidson Lecture Hall, Adams Building (CMC Campus)

Subject: Sign up to donate blood on Wednesday, September 14th!

The first blood drive of the year is Wednesday, September 14th from 8am to 8pm in SCC 108! Each donor will get a free t-shirt, a free haircut from Sport Clips, and a free hamburger and milkshake from Bakers.

Subject: Matriculate Advising Fellow Applications are open - apply by 9/19!
Matriculate is a college access non-profit that supports high-achieving, low/moderate-income high school students to apply and enroll in a best-fit college by pairing students with Advising Fellows, who serve as mentors through the college application process. Matriculate provides the training and support needed to support students virtually and learn about college access. We are currently recruiting students to serve as Advising Fellows at Pomona.

Apply at https://bit.ly/3RcVmwU<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F3RcVmwU&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7C2c1c33b3239a48510b8d08da902eac7f%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637980827385793796%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=JPR9MGSI2cLgv3mcVYP1PaSkIz6Pf0sIUvG5Tp76WYA%3D&reserved=0> by 9/19!

Subject: Apply Today: Social Justice Fellowship üåé
The Napier Initiative is a partnership between the Pilgrim Place senior community and the five undergraduate Claremont Colleges to encourage leadership for social change. This mentoring program links Napier Fellows interested in social change with elders at Pilgrim Place who have built a lifetime of experience, leadership, and professional skills in fostering social justice for all people.

Click the link for more information on how to apply: https://tinyurl.com/napierinitiativeapply<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fnapierinitiativeapply&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7C2c1c33b3239a48510b8d08da902eac7f%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637980827385793796%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=sYJMm5xQy%2BGfUoB8OrzHd0cFYgjk08J3%2FweQd%2FnoyR4%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: The EmPOWER Center - Weekly Support Group for Survivors of Sexual Assault
10-week group for 7C students of all gender identities who have experienced sexual assault, recently or long ago. Survivors explore their feelings & receive support while working through the healing process in a confidential space. Group facilitated by a Project Sister therapist. Mondays, 5-6:30pm, starting 9/19 @EmPOWER Center (1030 Dartmouth Ave.).

If interested in joining, please call 909.623.1619 & ask to be placed on the Claremont Colleges support group list, latest by 9/14.

Subject: Join The Student Life this fall.
Gain real-world journalism experience with a dedicated staff of over 130+ students across the 7Cs. Write for one of TSL's five editorial desks, which include news, sports, opinions, arts & culture and special projects. TSL has positions for students interested in photography, illustration, data visualizations, business, development and distribution roles (drive our golf-cart to deliver the paper once a week!).

Paid positions are offered. Reach out to editor@tsl.news<mailto:editor@tsl.news> with questions.
\Terminate\
Subject: Do you enjoy working with kids? Are you looking for a meaningful, in-person way to give back to the community?
 If so, consider becoming a Science Bus teacher! Science Bus volunteers lead interactive lessons and experiments covering everything from astronomy to forensics! Lessons are every Friday from 1-3pm; the lesson plan, experiment/class materials, and transportation are provided. (We offer free boba/coffee after each lesson!)

Join our mailing list here: https://tinyurl.com/scibus47<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fscibus47&data=05%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cf66568003ba14f4039dd08da8c44fede%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637976525202660207%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=bgUD0MWjyUaKSFS3kP8%2BSVH%2BOmG291NAR8vMyP9VC98%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Audition for "If Nobody Does Remarkable Things" THIS WEEKEND!
When a category 6 dust storm strikes, a former high-profile climate activist is visited by an old flame with a new proposal to try to help the planet. But why should Anna trust Joel this time after what he did 14 years ago? A fierce new play about climate change and forgiveness that explores what happens when we reach the point of no return.

Stop by our department or email aaff2022@pomona.edu<mailto:aaff2022@pomona.edu> to read a copy of the script.

Subject: Join the Claremont Investment Banking Club!
Introducing 5C students to investment banking through comprehensive lectures and alumni info sessions while preparing members for the rigorous recruiting process with technical, behavioral, networking, and interview mentorship from upperclassmen. Apply here or contact us to learn more!
\Terminate\
Subject: Enroll in HIST 147 - Mughal India!
There is still room in History 147 - Mughal India, taught by Pomona history Professor Arash Khazeni. The class meets Wednesdays 1:15-4:00 pm. See description below.
The history of the Mughal Empire of South Asia from its creation in 1526 by Central Asian warrior princes to its fall in the Sepoy Rebellion in 1858. Explores interactions between Muslim and Hindu societies, Indo-Persian imperial court culture, the Indian Ocean world, and the advent of the East India Company and colonialism.
\Terminate\

Subject: Hillel + Chaplains of the Claremont Colleges   Celebrate Shabbat on campus this and every Friday night!
Claremont Hillel welcomes all students, faculty and staff, from all backgrounds (Jewish and not Jewish!) to the McAlister Center (919 N Columbia, between Kravis Center @ CMC and the Library).

Every week, we host open Shabbat services at 5:30 PM for ~45 minutes, and all are welcome to join for song and prayer.
At 6:30, all are welcome for a beautiful home-cooked kosher-style Shabbat dinner made by our very own Chef Joy. Bring friends!
Join Sunday 9/4 for ice cream 12:30-2:30 @ McAlister too!

Subject: Donate your items to ReCoop!
Cleaning out your dorm and need to get rid of some things? Donate them to ReCoop! Each fall, ReCoop sells gently used student items, helping promote sustainability and affordable prices for common dorm goods. Donation collection is happening NOW -- each dorm has a donation station set up, with a big cart and a blue tape zone. Leave furniture, fridges, and other big items in the tape zone, and put any smaller items in the cart!

Subject: Participate in an HCI study and receive $15!

The Pomona Human Computer Interaction Lab is running a study on collaborative art, and we are recruiting participants. If you are over the age of 18, have normal vision (contacts are good, just no glasses), do not have a history of epilepsy, and would be comfortable with drawing together with another participant (no art experience needed!), sign up to participate in the study at this link: bit.ly/hci-lab-draw. Compensation is $15 and the study is expected to last 1 hour.

Subject: Interested in studying in South Africa during the Spring 2023 semester?

Centered on the theme of "Globalization, the Environment and Society," and based at the University of Cape Town, this program's overall educational purpose is to enable participants to gain a deeper understanding of the natural world and its interconnections with human activity. This is a unique program offered only in the spring and run by Pomona College, Macalester College, and Swarthmore College.

Subject: Spring 2023 in Cape Town - Deadline APRIL 28!

Interested in studying in South Africa during the Spring 2023 semester?

Centered on the theme of "Globalization, the Environment and Society," and based at the University of Cape Town, this program's overall educational purpose is to enable participants to gain a deeper understanding of the natural world and its interconnections with human activity. This is a unique program offered only in the spring and run by Pomona College, Macalester College, and Swarthmore College.

Please return our clothing rack, side table, and metal tray. These items were not free but were being used to supply designated free items (clothing, flyers, and foldable silicone cups). The Sustainability Office has a limited budget but is committed to providing resources for students to make sustainability more accessible. We cannot do that if items keep getting stolen.

Subject: Participate in HCI study and receive $15!

The Pomona Human Computer Interaction Lab is running a study on collaborative art, and we are recruiting participants. If you are over the age of 18, have normal vision (contacts are good, just no glasses), do not have a history of epilepsy, and would be comfortable with drawing together with another participant (no art experience needed!), sign up to participate in the study at this link: bit.ly/hci-lab-draw. Compensation is $15 and the study is expected to last 1 hour.

Subject: English Department  - Jesse McCarthy today, Friday 4/22!

Join the Pomona College English Department for a reading and talk, entitled "Black Intellectuals and the Public Humanities" from Jesse McCarthy.

He is a contributor to Richard Wright in Context, Ralph Ellison in Context, and the Cambridge Companion to the Essay. He is editor of the forthcoming Norton Library edition of W. E. B. Du Bois's The Souls of Black Folk and author of Who Will Pay Reparations on My Soul?, a collection of essays, and a novel, The Fugitivities.

Subject: Making Peace With Food and Respecting Your Body with Kelly Barnes: VIRTUAL PRESENTATION!

This virtual presentation will cover two principles of Intuitive Eating: Making Peace With Food and Respecting Your Body. You will leave with a better understanding of weight stigma, how to take care of your body, and how to look at all foods in a more neutral and nourishing way.

This event was supported by the Pitzer Campus Life Committee.

Subject: Apply to be an AAMP Mentor!

The Asian American Mentor Program (AAMP) is opening applications for the 2022-2023 mentor cohort! Being an AAMP mentor is highly rewarding. You will meet new people, explore new ideas, and serve as leaders in our community. As a mentor, you will advise Asian Pacific Islander Desi American (APIDA) first year students, plan educational and social events, and foster dialogue around issues important to APIDA and other communities at Pomona College. Subject: Community Transformative Justice Multi-Class Project

Next fall, a collective of 5C students and professors are organizing a multi-class project to research and organize for transformative justice spaces and restorative justice policies that provide students with institutional support for instances of interpersonal harm that are separate from carceral responses. All classes will be involved in political education and community events. Link to look at the classes offered: https://tinyurl.com/RJ-Multi-Class-Project<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FRJ-Multi-Class-Project&data=05%7C01%7Csfaa2021%40MYMAIL.POMONA.EDU%7C4d7f0c7cc55443939cfb08da23be3007%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637861597011479711%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=6QITFSX4itPZvEnt%2BAq3B6jwEMsAOrKKwC2tB%2BCjqxA%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Participate in an HCI study and receive $15!

The Pomona Human Computer Interaction Lab is running a study on collaborative art, and we are recruiting participants. If you are over the age of 18, have normal vision (contacts are good, just no glasses), do not have a history of epilepsy, and would be comfortable with drawing together with another participant (no art experience needed!), sign up to participate in the study at this link: bit.ly/hci-lab-draw. Compensation is $15 and the study is expected to last 1 hour.

Subject: Jesse McCarthy, Friday 4/22 @ 4:15 PM in Ena Thompson, Crookshank 108!

Join the Pomona College English Department for a reading and talk, entitled Black Intellectuals and Public Humanities from Jesse McCarthy.

McCarthy is a contributor to Richard Wright in Context, Ralph Ellison in Context, and the Cambridge Companion to the Essay. He is editor of the forthcoming Norton Library edition of W. E. B. Du Bois's The Souls of Black Folk and author of Who Will Pay Reparations on My Soul?, a collection of essays, and a novel, The Fugitivities.

Subject: Intuitive Eating with Kelly Barnes | Wednesday, April 27th, 7-8pm

This virtual presentation will cover two principles of Intuitive Eating: Making Peace With Food and Respecting Your Body. You will leave with a better understanding of weight stigma, how to take care of your body, and how to look at all foods in a more neutral and nourishing way.

This event was supported by the Pitzer Campus Life Committee.
\Terminate\
Subject: Evelyn McDonnell on "The Power of Girl Groups"
TODAY! Thurs, April 21 | 4:30pm | Estella 1051

Join us for the final talk in our Movement(s) Speakers Series. Evelyn McDonnell, prof of journalism & author of "Women Who Rock: Bessie to Beyonce, Girl Groups to Riot Grrrl", traces the arc of girl-group development from the '30s to today, examining how acts like the Boswell Sisters, the Pointer Sisters, the Runaways, the Bags, the Go-Gos, L7, & the Linda Lindas have spearheaded musical innovations in the face of exploitation & abuse.
\Terminate\
Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents  Humanities Futures (An Alumni Panel)
Thurs, April 28 | 5pm | Estella 1051

Calling all humanities majors! Wondering what you can do with your English, literature, history, philosophy, music, theatre/dance, religious studies, language, classics, media studies, art/art history degree after your time at Pomona? Join us to hear from a panel of Pomona alums who are putting their degrees to work on a variety of paths, from grad school to enviro science, arts/museum executive work, and more. It's part of our Humanities Toolkit series.

Subject: Apply to be an AAMP Mentor!

The Asian American Mentor Program (AAMP) is opening applications for the 2022-2023 mentor cohort! Being an AAMP mentor is highly rewarding. You will meet new people, explore new ideas, and serve as leaders in our community. As a mentor, you will advise Asian Pacific Islander Desi American (APIDA) first year students, plan educational and social events, and foster dialogue around issues important to APIDA and other communities at Pomona College. Subject: Mental Illness Education and MIND Lab Attitudes Study

If you are interested, you can contact this email: mindlab@pomona.edu<mailto:mindlab@pomona.edu> If you are a Pomona Intro Psych Student, sign up on SONA. Cannot participate if you have taken an upper-level psychology course (anything beyond Intro Psych). Participants can receive $20-$30 in compensation or 2 research credits for Intro Psych and up to $10.

Subject: Intuitive Eating with Kelly Barnes

This virtual presentation will cover two principles of Intuitive Eating: Making Peace With Food and Respecting Your Body. You will leave with a better understanding of weight stigma, how to take care of your body, and how to look at all foods in a more neutral and nourishing way.

This event was supported by the Pitzer Campus Life Committee.

\Terminate\
Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents - Evelyn McDonnell on "The Power of Girl Groups"

Thurs, April 21 | 4:30pm | Estella 1051

Join us for the final talk in our Movement(s) Speakers Series. In this talk, Evelyn McDonnell, prof of journalism & author of "Women Who Rock: Bessie to Beyonce, Girl Groups to Riot Grrrl", traces the arc of girl-group development from the '30s to today, examining how acts like the Boswell Sisters, the Pointer Sisters, the Runaways, the Bags, the Go-Gos, L7, & the Linda Lindas have spearheaded musical innovations in the face of exploitation & abuse.

The Asian American Mentor Program (AAMP) is opening applications for the 2022-2023 mentor cohort! Being an AAMP mentor is highly rewarding. You will meet new people, explore new ideas, and serve as leaders in our community. As a mentor, you will advise Asian Pacific Islander Desi American (APIDA) first year students, plan educational and social events, and foster dialogue around issues important to APIDA and other communities at Pomona College. Subject: International and Domestic Programs Info Session - Global Partnership Courses Info Session

This fall, Pomona College will offer three Global Partnership Courses to juniors and seniors. These courses offer innovative opportunities to engage with critical global issues and experiential learning across continents and borders. We hope these courses give you an opportunity to engage with people, ideas, and perspectives around the world without having to leave Claremont. Join our info session Tuesday, April 19 from 3-4 p.m. in SCC 217.
\Terminate\
Subject: Introduction to Body Love with Talia Cooper: addressing the double whammy of feeling bad about feeling bad about your body

This workshop is for anyone who's ever felt negatively towards their own body. We will create a supportive space to learn about the history of the body positive movement, talk about what this means for us today, and share tips for moving towards body acceptance and finding body peace. We'll also have time to stretch, breathe and play.

This event was supported by the Pitzer Campus Life Committee.

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents - Maurice Maga√±a on Youth Movements in Mexico

THIS THURSDAY, April 14 | 4:30pm | Estella 1051

Join us for the 5th presentation in our Movement(s) Speakers Series. In this talk, sociocultural anthropologist Maurice Maga√±a explores how urban and migrant youth in the Mexican state of Oaxaca embrace subcultures from hip-hop to punk and adopt creative organizing practices to create meaningful channels of participation in local social and political life. Masks are required.

Subject: Introduction to Body Love with Talia Cooper: addressing the double whammy of feeling bad about feeling bad about your body

This workshop is for anyone who's ever felt negatively towards their own body. We will create a supportive space to learn about the history of the body positive movement, talk about what this means for us today, and share tips for moving towards body acceptance and finding body peace. We'll also have time to stretch, breathe and play.

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents   Maurice Maga√±a on Youth Movements in Mexico

Thurs, April 14 | 4:30pm | Estella Lab, Argue Auditorium
Join us for the 5th presentation in our Movement(s) Speakers Series. In this talk, sociocultural anthropologist Maurice Maga√±a explores how urban and migrant youth in the Mexican state of Oaxaca embrace subcultures from hip-hop to punk and adopt creative organizing practices to create meaningful channels of participation in local social and political life. Masks are required.
\Terminate\
Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents - Evelyn McDonnell on "The Power of Girl Groups"

Thurs, April 21 | 4:30pm | Estella 1051

Join us for the final talk in our Movement(s) Speakers Series. In this talk, Evelyn McDonnell, prof of journalism & author of ""Women Who Rock: Bessie to Beyonce, Girl Groups to Riot Grrrl"", traces the arc of girl-group development from the '30s to today, examining how acts like the Boswell Sisters, the Pointer Sisters, the Runaways, the Bags, the Go-Gos, L7, & the Linda Lindas have spearheaded musical innovations in the face of exploitation & abuse.

Subject: Pomona College Department of Theatre and Dance - See "SCISSORING" this weekend!

"Scissoring" follows Abigail Bauer, as she struggles to reconcile her professional ambitions, personal relationships, religious beliefs, and internalized shame. Abigail receives guidance from First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt and Eleanor's devoted friend and lover, Lorena Hickok. Through it all, Abigail must find the courage to be unabashedly herself.

          Saturday, April 9th at 8pm
          Sunday, April 1 at 2pm

Subject: Do you enjoy working with kids? Do you want to get more involved in the community?

If so, consider becoming a Science Bus teacher! Lessons are Fridays from 1-3pm; lesson plans, experiment materials, & transportation are provided.

Subject: Recruiting 5C Students on the Autism Spectrum for Senior Thesis

Hello! For my senior linguistics thesis, I'm examining how autistic individuals process language. I'm looking for participants! If you've been diagnosed professionally or have self-diagnosed, please take this survey to let me know you're interested in participating and to check your eligibility: https://forms.gle/REEnMor1s8udp7Ss6<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FREEnMor1s8udp7Ss6&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cb4f31ebb6e98414dba4308da10e2791d%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637840862115677378%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=4hchG93JoETiBN7ddPTgF9%2FPThyhFJOoa%2BLhJvFfmT8%3D&reserved=0>.

You'll be paid $15 an hour for your participation, and the experiment is expected to take around 3 hours. Please don't hesitate to email me with any questions!

Subject: Sagehens Abroad: Student Stories From Around the World (International and Domestic Programs Office Podcast): Episode 13

Tune in to listen as host Talia Ivry '21, a religious studies major, interviews Liz Murray '21, a sociology major, about her time in Ireland with Arcadia University: Trinity College Dublin in the spring of 2020. Talia and Liz have a lively conversation about the learning curve of university classes, adjusting to life in Dublin, and connecting with family heritage abroad. https://www.pomona.edu/administration/international-domestic-programs/student-identity-and-experiences/sagehens-abroad-podcast

Subject: Intuitive Eating with Amy Clover - VIRTUAL EVENT


A virtual talk and Q&A featuring Amy Clover, Certified Intuitive Eating Counselor and Owner & Anti-Diet Health Coach at Strong Inside Out.

This talk will cover Amy's story and how Intuitive Eating works to heal tricky relationships with food. We'll discuss how Intuitive Eating redirects our food focus from rules to body attunement and helps to create a self-care framework and tips for starting your IE journey!

\Terminate\
Subject: Department of Asian Languages and Literatures, Department of History, Department of Asian Studies - Chinese Protests in Years Ending with the Number Nine: Shanghai 1919, Beijing 1989, Hong Kong 2019

On 3/28, 4:15-5:30pm in Hahn 108 Professor Wasserstrom of UC Irvine will be presenting a talk comparing and connecting the upheavals that shook Shanghai, Beijing and other Chinese cities during the May 4th Movement of 1919 and the Tiananmen upheaval of 1989, during which protesters explicitly linked themselves to a tradition of patriotic action by educated youth that had started eighty years earlier, and other topics.
\Terminate\
Subject: Pomona College Judicial Council - Roundtable #3 THIS Wednesday!

Join us for our 3rd roundtable discussion this Wednesday 3/30 from 4:30-5:30pm in the Hart Room 201 at the SCC. We will be discussing the role of compensation and restitution in the disciplinary process. This event is part of a series of roundtable discussions being hosted by JBoard to reflect on and discuss the philosophy of our conduct process. EVERYONE is welcome - you do not need to be proficient in the Student Code or familiar with the conduct process.

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents - Maurice Maga√±a on Youth Movements in Mexico ***CHANGE OF DATE***

Thurs, April 14 | 4:30pm | Estella Lab, Argue Auditorium

Join us for the 5th talk in our Movement(s) Speakers Series. In this talk, sociocultural anthropologist Maurice Maga√±a explores how urban and migrant youth in the Mexican state of Oaxaca embrace subcultures from hip-hop to punk and adopt creative organizing practices to create meaningful channels of participation in local social and political life. (The talk has been rescheduled from the original date of 3/31.)

Subject: 5C Science Bus is Looking for Volunteers!
Do you enjoy working with kids? Do you want to get more involved in the community?
If so, consider becoming a Science Bus teacher! Science Bus works to instill a passion for science in elementary students in the Pomona Unified School District through interactive lessons and experiments covering everything from astronomy to forensics to friction! Lessons are Fridays from 1-3pm; lesson plans, experiment materials, & transportation are provided.
Join our mailing list: www.tinyurl.com/5cscibus<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.tinyurl.com%2F5cscibus&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7C1e9dbc0855bf40850bd208da0db842f1%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637837382284617318%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=PxPEUKcdTD%2FLX%2B3wFe13Ol0UcEno3deAWnK7x%2FZRjNw%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Judicial Council Chair Applications Due Sunday!
The Pomona College Judicial Council (J-Board) invites rising juniors and seniors to apply to be a chair for the 2022-2023 academic year! The Judicial Council is a student-run body with disciplinary authority over student conduct. The chairs select and train panelists, preside at hearings, and advise administrators, faculty, and students on the Student Code. This is a paid position. Apps are due Sunday, March 27. https://tinyurl.com/jboardchair22<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fjboardchair22&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7C1e9dbc0855bf40850bd208da0db842f1%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637837382284617318%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=1C8HyhC3dFQmKEhC7pv8A6OUMfvrAMQ%2Bj1IGWZJlzzU%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents: Maurice Maga√±a on Youth Movements in Mexico
Thurs, March 31 | 4:30pm | Estella Lab, Argue Auditorium
Join us for the 5th presentation in our Movement(s) Speakers Series. In this talk, sociocultural anthropologist Maurice Maga√±a explores how urban and migrant youth in the Mexican state of Oaxaca embrace subcultures from hip-hop to punk and adopt creative organizing practices to create meaningful channels of participation in local social and political life. Masks are required.
\Terminate\
Subject: Intuitive Eating with Amy Clover - VIRTUAL EVENT


A virtual talk and Q&A featuring Amy Clover, Certified Intuitive Eating Counselor and Owner & Anti-Diet Health Coach at Strong Inside Out.
This talk will cover Amy's story and how Intuitive Eating works to heal tricky relationships with food. We'll discuss how Intuitive Eating redirects our food focus from rules to body attunement and helps to create a self-care framework and tips for starting your IE journey!

Attend our info session tonight to learn how you can help redistribute leftover meals from our dining halls to a community that could put them to good use!

Subject: Departments of Asian Languages and Literatures, History, and Asian Studies
Chinese Protests in Years Ending with the Number Nine: Shanghai 1919, Beijing 1989, Hong Kong 2019
On 3/28, 4:15-5:30pm in Hahn 108 Professor Wasserstrom of UC Irvine will be presenting a talk comparing and connecting the upheavals that shook Shanghai, Beijing and other Chinese cities during the May 4th Movement of 1919 and the Tiananmen upheaval of 1989, during which protesters explicitly linked themselves to a tradition of patriotic action by educated youth that had started eighty years earlier, and other topics.

Subject: Outdoor Education Center/Women's Union - No Man's Land Film Festival Returns

This Thursday!  After two years, the Pomona College Outdoor Education Center is proud to once again host a screening of the No Man's Land Film Festival in Partnership with the Women's Union! This film festival aims to un-define feminine in adventure and sport through films created by women, non-binary people, and transgender men across the globe. Subject: Humanities Studio Fellowships, Call for Applications: Due April 8
If you're planning to graduate in Spring 2023, and if you'll be writing a senior thesis with a humanities-oriented topic (no matter your home department), we invite you to apply for one of the Humanities Studio Undergraduate Fellowships. Learn more about the Fellowship, and about next year's theme, Human||Nature, at bit.ly/hsufapp. Applications are due by Friday, April 8.
 Feel free to contact Humanities Studio Director Kevin Dettmar or Assoc. Director Gretchen Rognlien with any questions.

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents-Podcasting the Humanities: A Workshop Series
APPLICATIONS DUE TODAY! In this 3-part workshop series, beginning on Mon, March 21, students will learn the practical details of developing a humanities-focused podcast-from conception to production & circulation-from podcaster (& DJ & pop music/culture writer) Oliver Wang. Students who complete the first 3 workshops will have the option to record, edit, & receive peer/pro feedback on their own 10-15 minute test episode. Space limited, priority to Pomona students. Apply at bit.ly/podhum

Subject: Do you enjoy working with kids? Do you want to get more involved in the community?

If so, consider becoming a 5C Science Bus teacher! Science Bus works to instill a passion for science in elementary students in the Pomona Unified School District through interactive lessons + experiments covering everything from astronomy to friction! Lessons are Fridays from 1-3pm; lesson plans, experiment materials, and transportation are provided.

Join our mailing list: https://tinyurl.com/5cscibus

Subject: Mental Illness Education and MIND Lab Attitudes Study

Want to learn about schizophrenia? Recruiting participants for MIND Lab study! If you are interested, you can contact this email: mindlab@pomona.edu<mailto:mindlab@pomona.edu> If you are a Pomona Intro Psych Student, sign up on SONA. Cannot participate if you have taken an upper-level psychology course (anything beyond Intro Psych). Participants can receive $20-$30 in compensation or 2 research credits for Intro Psych and up to $10.

Subject: Intuitive Eating Journaling Workshop with Jared Levenson

A virtual journaling workshop featuring intuitive eating counselor and mindfulness expert Jared Levenson.

We'll practice a journaling method based on the science of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy which can help you regain sanity around food and make wiser eating decisions. This live workshop will be interactive and you'll walk away with a completed journal template you can apply to your day-to-day life immediately.

Subject: Join us for the first meeting of Inclusive Claremont!

Join us today (Mar 7) at 6pm for the first meeting (in a long time) of Inclusive Claremont, a grassroots coalition of college students and community members advocating for affordable housing justice. In partnership with experienced housing activists in Claremont, we'll be doing community education about the housing crisis and strategizing to build student power. The meeting will be on Zoom: you can RSVP at bit.ly/5chousing1 and access the Zoom at bit.ly/InclusiveClaremont.

Subject: Pomona Student Union - Capitalism and Environmental Sustainability

Join the PSU as it hosts a discussion between John Ikerd (Professor of Agricultural & Applied Economics) and Andrew Curley (Professor of Geography) about capitalism and sustainability on Zoom at 7 pm PT this Monday, March 7th. Topics of conversation will include whether capitalism can be environmentally sustainable, what an environmentally just economic system could look like, and how to get there.

Subject: FLIGHT committee at the AARC - FLI X APIDA Story Circle

This space is curated for first-gen low income, APIDA identifying individuals. The aim of the FLI X APIDA Story Circle is to provide participants a welcoming space to share experiences of isolation and connection as a FLI and APIDA person at the 5C's. The event will be held on Thursday, March 3rd, from 7 to 8:15 PM at the Queer Resource Center. Event maximum capacity is 12, so availability will be based on whoever signs up first.

Subject: Godzilla: The Art of Disaster Politics | Screening + Talk

Thursday, March 3, 6-9 pm-Join us for a screening of Shin Godzilla (2016) at 6 pm with movie concessions followed by a talk from Pomona College professor of politics Tom Le at 8 pm. This talk examines how film director Hideaki Anno continues the critique of government power, militarism, and environmental politics in the newest installment of the Godzilla franchise, Shin Godzilla. In conjunction with exhibition Each Day Begins with the Sun Rising: Four Artists from Hiroshima at the Benton.

Subject: The Pomona Student Union is Recruiting!

Do you like TedTalks? Are you interested in promoting dialogue on campus? If so, you should think about joining the Pomona Student Union (PSU)!

The PSU is a student-run organization committed to promoting honest and open dialogue on campus through speaker events, debates, and student discussions on contemporary issues. For more information, look out for our upcoming info sessions and please consider applying!

The Draper Center and Uncommon Good want to create a mentorship program for Latine-identifying students in grades 4th-12th in the Pomona Valley area. We're hoping to find excited, Latine-identifying volunteers who are able to dedicate an hour or two a week to these students and provide mentorship, advice, identity empowerment, and friendship!

Subject: Pomona College Department of Music - Pomona College Orchestra Concerts

Join us on Friday, March 4 at 8pm or Sunday, March 6 at 3pm in Bridges Hall of Music for these exciting free concerts! The Pomona College Orchestra will perform a world premiere composition by Tom Flaherty, selected songs by Florence Price, and Jean Sibelius' resplendent violin concerto, Op. 47 (chirp chirp!). The program features faculty soprano Melissa Givens and the divine Megan Chang (PO '23), winner of the 2021 Pomona College Orchestra Concerto Competition.

Subject: Claremont Students of Public Health - Workshop on Recognizing Signs of struggle

On Monday, March 7th (3/7) @ 7PM via Zoom, Join Claremont Students of Public Health's Mental Health Workshop on Recognizing Signs of Struggle with Pomona College Professor Katrina Keil! Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents: Publishing with an Academic Press

Tues, March 1 | 4:30pm | Crookshank, Ena Thompson Rm

Hear practical advice about publishing scholarly writing with an academic press from Ken Wissoker, Exec Editor at Duke Univ Press, who has published more than 1,200 books from authors including Donna Haraway, Achille Mbembe, Lauren Berlant, Jack Halberstam, & Christina Sharpe. The event is part of our Humanities Toolkit series of interviews & workshops to help humanities scholars carry their work beyond campus. Learn more at bit.ly/humstudio

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents "Podcasting the Humanities: A Workshop Series"

In this 3-part workshop series, beginning on Mon, March 21, students will learn the practical details of developing a humanities-focused podcast-from conception to production & circulation-from podcaster (& DJ & pop music/culture writer) Oliver Wang. Students who complete the first 3 workshops will have the option to record, edit, & receive peer/pro feedback on their own 10-15 minute test episode. Space limited, priority to Pomona students. Learn more & apply by March 14 at bit.ly/humpod
\Terminate\
Subject: Intuitive Eating, Mental Health, and Social Justice with Becky Belinsky M.

A virtual presentation on intuitive eating, mental health, and social justice featuring guest speaker Becky Belinsky M.A., LMFT

This talk will explore the intersection of Intuitive Eating, mental health, and social justice. The focus will be on how Intuitive Eating, disordered eating, and weight stigma impact mental health, as well as accessibility issues related to mental health and Intuitive Eating.
\Terminate\
Subject: FLIGHT committee at the AARC - FLI X APIDA Story Circle

The aim of the FLI X APIDA Story Circle is to provide participants a welcoming space to share experiences of isolation and connection as a FLI and APIDA person at the 5C's. The event will be held on Thursday, March 3rd, from 7 to 8:15 PM at the Queer Resource Center. This space is curated for first-gen low income, APIDA identifying individuals. Event maximum capacity is 12, so availability will be based on whoever signs up first!

Subject: First Meeting for the Equity in the Environment Program

Are you a first or second-year student interested in ecology, geology, and/or the environment? Are you from a BIPOC or underrepresented background? If so, you are invited to apply to a new program, run through the Quantitative Skills Center, called Equity in the Environment designed to help equip underrepresented students for careers in these disciplines. You do NOT have to be a declared major to join! Our first meeting is this Tuesday! Email Christina for details!

Subject: PAYS/Draper Center - PAYS Summer Staff Info Session

The Pomona College Academy for Youth Success (PAYS) program is a three-year college-access opportunity for high school students in the Los Angeles, San Bernardino, Orange, and Riverside Counties. We are looking to hire staff members (Teaching Assistants, Writing Tutor, Math Tutor, and Community/Resident Advisors) for the return of the summer residential experience. Join us for an info session TODAY, Monday February 21st @ 6pm at the Draper Center to learn more!

Subject: Sagehens Abroad: Student Stories From Around the World (International and Domestic Programs Office Podcast): Episode 11

Tune in to listen as Host Talia Ivry '21, a religious studies major, interviews Pipi Gao '22, a math and media studies double major, about her time in Paris in the spring of 2020. Talia and Pipi have a lively conversation about studying abroad as an international student, overcoming the initial fear of communicating in the host language, and staying in a homestay. https://www.pomona.edu/administration/international-domestic-programs/student-identity-and-experiences/sagehens-abroad-podcast

Subject: The EmPOWER Center- Support Group for Survivors of Dating/Domestic Violence
This 8-week virtual support group is for 7C students who have experienced dating or domestic violence, whether recently or long ago. The group will provide survivors with a confidential space to receive support while they explore their feelings and work through the healing process. Thursdays from 6-7:30pm PST, begins 3/3 (sign up by 3/1: k.hassan@houseofruthinc.org). This EmPOWER Center group is in collaboration with House of Ruth. Open to students of all gender identities.
\Terminate\

Subject: Hiring for consultants!

Claremont Sustainability Consulting is the first and only environmental consulting club at the 5Cs. We help major companies, local family businesses, and other entities create sustainability strategies, evaluate the financial and technical feasibility of green initiatives, and support KPI establishment and tracking. We are recruiting driven 5C students interested in sustainability and the environmental field to apply!

\Terminate\
Subject: Anthropology Department - Made in Mecca: Research, Knowledge, and Technology in the Islamic Sanctuary, a talk by Omer Shah, PhD Columbia University

Omer Shah is an anthropologist of science, religion and expertise. This talk focuses on efforts by the Saudi state to transform the holy city of Mecca into a laboratory for crowd management, surveillance, and logistics. Shah's work explores the uneven collaboration and competition of religious and secular knowledges in this age of calculative reason. Shah will also discuss a new project based on fieldwork in Pakistan.
\Terminate\
Subject: Do you enjoy working with kids? Are you looking for a meaningful way to give back to the community?

If so, consider becoming a 5C Science Bus teacher! Science Bus teachers work to instill a passion for science in elementary students in the Pomona Unified School District through engaging, interactive lessons and experiments covering everything from astronomy to forensic science to friction! Lessons are every Friday from 1-3pm; the lesson plan, materials, and transportation are provided :)
\Terminate\
Subject: TONIGHT: Diversity in Law Virtual Workshop (Focus on the LGBTQ+ Community)

With a focus on the LGBTQ+ community, this virtual workshop will discuss how to apply to and choose a law school. Students will get the opportunity to meet Dr. Elizabeth Bodamer (she/her/ella), a first-generation queer Latina with a Ph.D. in Sociology from Indiana University Bloomington and a J.D. from Indiana University Maurer School of Law.

Tonight, 4 - 5 p.m. | Feb. 10 | Virtual

Subject: FIRST MEETING - Crisis Text Line (CTL) Volunteers: 5Cs Chapter!

Are you looking for fulfilling volunteer work? Do you enjoy listening to others?

If so, you should consider volunteering for the CTL, an international text-based crisis hotline. See more about the opportunity to apply at: https://www.crisistextline.org/.

Our first meeting is on Wednesday Feb. 16 at SCC 217 from 7-8 pm. We support new & existing CTL members. If you are interested in applying to the CTL, then come check out our club & fill out the form: https://forms.gle/FjKWLiqPJkJZABHc7<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FFjKWLiqPJkJZABHc7&data=04%7C01%7Csfaa2021%40MYMAIL.POMONA.EDU%7Cf22c9cceed474bf8e1d908d9ecbd79da%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637801121727222062%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=5cdn1SOLIjFZuHX%2FtuQ8QCt0PWw1lfPEOQggEMbmO58%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Join the Equity in the Environment Program!

 Are you a first or second-year student interested in ecology, geology, and/or the environment? Are you from a BIPOC or underrepresented background? If so, you are invited to apply to a new program, run through the Quantitative Skills Center, called Equity in the Environment designed to help equip underrepresented students for careers in these disciplines. Subject: ISO GNC Performers and Collaborators for Senior Thesis

Are you a they/them? Genderfluid? Genderqueer? Agender?

Interested in performance but sick of performing gender?

Got a bit of a morbid curiosity?

Come help me with my thesis "Them Fatale: Trans Ghost Stories"! The final project will be a five-minute poetic film about limbo as a queer space and locus of freedom from gendered expectations. I will compensate you for your time! Reach out if interested in learning more!

Subject: Spotlight Musical Theatre: The Winner Takes It All

A queer ABBA musical, "The Winner Takes It All" finds couple Alex and Jamie, ex-criminals turned musicians, returning to their roots for one last heist. But, the auction they plan to burgle happens to be run by Jamie's ex. They realize there's more to heists than meets the eye. In a battle of wits, the winner takes it all.

December 9-11: 8:00 pm + 2:00 pm Sat matinee

Masks + 5C ID or proof of vaccination are required
\Terminate\

Subject: Sustainability Office: Plant a Succulent & Learn to Properly Sort Your Waste !

TONIGHT 7PM @ THE HIVE

Are you ever stuck trying to figure out whether you can recycle that plastic container? Whether you can really put those paper plates from Frary in the compost bin? What about the forks that say they're compostable? It's all very confusing, but The Sustainability Office is here to help! We welcome all to join us at the Hive, make an upcycled succulent planter and learn to properly sort your waste. Also -- FREE WATER BOTTLES FOR THE FIRST 25 PARTICIPANTS!

The Pacific Forum, a nonprofit private, foreign policy research institute focused on the Asia-Pacific region, will host two Pomona College undergraduate students sponsored by The Pacific Basin Institute at Pomona College for an eight-week internship in its Honolulu, Hawaii office. Apply via Handshake today: https://pomona.joinhandshake.com/edu/jobs/5880999<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpomona.joinhandshake.com%2Fedu%2Fjobs%2F5880999&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cbf4e3c6dba6a4fe6eda808d9e4e7830c%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637792505254697346%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=zwfuoYoaxI3N6yUiwbFw6oL47HUtolEnya17yBNT2gA%3D&reserved=0>

We are a non-profit run by college students dedicated to helping underprivileged high schoolers learn more about their colleges of interest and and their right fit. If interested, please fill out this very short application https://bit.ly/3ubdQoS<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F3ubdQoS&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cbf4e3c6dba6a4fe6eda808d9e4e7830c%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637792505254697346%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=TZdFtaJkqQoTMby3FrAv2quqraCbTDXuanOY1emuYMY%3D&reserved=0>!

We Think You Can Change the World, and We Want to Help!

Effective Altruism Claremont is a community of students trying to do as much good in the world as we can, especially by choosing our careers carefully. Given our limited personal resources, we have to focus on finding leverage points, then pushing hard on them. If this sounds like it would interest you, get on our email list (http://eepurl.com/hPl8dP<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Feepurl.com%2FhPl8dP&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cbf4e3c6dba6a4fe6eda808d9e4e7830c%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637792505254697346%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=D9cmjmyOkY6jMhbmlzg3LZDbh1Oo0QFF%2FjkKCInbrdg%3D&reserved=0>) and check out the events we're running this semester (https://ea-claremont.notion.site/Programs-and-Events-5b286e07d8de4257b6d915ae10af966f<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fea-claremont.notion.site%2FPrograms-and-Events-5b286e07d8de4257b6d915ae10af966f&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cbf4e3c6dba6a4fe6eda808d9e4e7830c%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637792505254697346%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=qYW0v2z6Sy%2B6EuSN5uPurhG3Q6ZD0T2xIKIqzLq9X9k%3D&reserved=0>)

Pitzer Campus Life Committee - Virtual Presentation: The 10 Principles of Intuitive Eating

Please join this virtual presentation on the 10 Principles of Intuitive Eating, featuring guest speaker Kacey Legnitto!

Intuitive Eating Fundamentals is an introduction to the evidenced-based, mind-body health approach, Intuitive Eating. In this presentation, we will discuss what Intuitive Eating is and the cultural influences that impact how we perceive food and our bodies.

This event is open to 5C students, faculty, staff, parents, and alumni.

5C Artists' Coalition - Destress with Art

Subject: Amazon Lockers are receiving packages

Just a reminder that you can send Amazon Packages to our two Amazon Lockers. Frary is located on the north entrance door to the Frary Dining Hall and Finn is located in the gazebo in front of the Frank Dining Hall.

Both locker systems are available for 7 day delivery, 24 hour pick up and no lines to pick up your packages.

Simply choose the Frary or Finn locker as your delivery address to have your Amazon package delivered to the locker most convenient to you.
\Terminate\
Subject: Did you know that thousands of to-go boxes are used DAILY at Pomona College, and many end up in the landfill instead of being composted?

Ask for a reusable Greebox instead! It can be washed thousands of times, saving resources, landfill space, and carbon emissions. Return it to Frank, Frary, or the Coop Fountain to get credit for a free box. FMI: sustainability@pomona.edu

Agave Review, a 7C literary and art journal, is accepting submissions for the Spring Issue; submissions window for this first round closes February 14. Poetry, prose (fiction, nonfiction), criticisms (film, art, theatre), and art-we'd love to review your work! Theme TBA, but we accept non-themed work as well.

Follow us on Instagram @5cagavereview to stay tuned into submission deadline updates, Agave Review upcoming events, and the creative work of your peers.

Subject: The Hive (Sontag Center): Hive Summer Fellowship Program 2022 - Applications Due February 11th

Hello designers! We are excited to present the Hive Summer Fellowship Program! This summer, the Hive will be awarding stipends of up to $4,500 (per student) to support small teams (2-4 people) working on a variety of design projects that will use human-centered design to solve important problems relevant to our present world. Subject: Pitzer Campus Life Committee - Attend a Virtual Presentation on The 10 Principles of Intuitive Eating featuring Kacey Legnitto, MS, RD, CEDRD-S!

Join us on February 2nd @ 6pm for this virtual presentation. We'll discuss what Intuitive Eating is, the cultural influences that impact how we perceive food and our bodies, and how diets and other cultural influences interfere with our mind-body connection and lead us astray from our natural ability to intuitively eat.

Subject: Do you speak an uncommonly taught language?
Pomona Linguistics and Cognitive Science is looking for a student to participate in LGCS 125 Field Methods in Linguistics, a class where 10-15 students and the professor will try to learn and describe your language!

Paid position (above normal campus $ rate!) 2.5 hours a week (and potentially more)

Please get in touch with Prof. Toni Cook at toni.cook@pomona.edu to see if you're a match!

Being on a production crew is a great way to meet new people, be involved in a show without actually going onstage, and add a new skill to your resume!

Subject: YOU'RE INVITED TO THE CIC
Pomona College is a member of the Career and Internship Connections (CIC) 14-school consortium. Established in 1998, the CIC holds an annual job and internship fair. Due to COVID-19, the 2022 CIC Job and Internship Fair will take place virtually. This is your chance to meet with over 90 employers from a wide range of industries, explore full-time job opportunities and discover available internships!

Subject: Spotlight Musical Theatre - The Winner Takes It All

A queer ABBA musical, The Winner Takes It All, finds couple Alex and Jamie, ex-criminals turned musicians, returning to their roots for one last heist. But, the auction they plan to burgle happens to be run by Jamie's ex. They realize there's more to heists than meets the eye. In a battle of wits, the winner takes it all.
December 9-11: 8:00 pm + 2:00 pm Sat matinee
Spotlight MT. Large Studio, Seaver. Seating is First-Come, First-Served. Masks + 5C ID or proof of vaccination are required.

Subject: Shirt Fundraiser to Combat FGM and Uplift Black Artists

I am selling T-shirts whose profit will be going towards building counseling centers in Tanzania. These counseling centers benefit women who have undergone through FGM. The goal is to sell 150 shirts. You can also contribute donations on the same page. The shirt was designed by a local Atlanta black artist, Oni.

Subject: Sagehens Abroad: Student Stories From Around the World (Study Abroad Podcast) Episode 9

Tune in as Host Tashi Rosenthal '21, a Neuroscience major, interviews Jed Kronenberg '21, an Economics  major/Chinese minor, about fall 2019 abroad in Taipei, Taiwan on the CIEE Intensive Chinese Language & Culture program. Listen as they discuss reasons why he chose the program, extracurricular activities and building community, living with a Taiwanese roommate, Chinese courses and language acquisition, and adjusting to living abroad.

Subject: AAMP Impact Committee: Movie Screening

Join the Asian American Mentorship Program (AAMP) Impact Committee THIS SUNDAY for a movie screening on ""Persepolis"" (2007), an animated film based on Marjane Satrapi's graphic novel about her life in pre and post-revolutionary Iran. The film will cover themes on growth from childhood to adulthood, rebellion, politics in Iran in the 70-80s, war, and family.

Snacks & boba will be provided! :)

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents - Writing for General-Interest Magazines

Tues, Nov 30 | 4:30pm | The Benton Museum Pavilion
Pomona students are invited to join us as we welcome Lenika Cruz, senior editor of culture at "The Atlantic," to discuss writing, pitching a story, working with an editor, and other insider tips for publishing with public-facing outlets such as "The Atlantic" and "The New Yorker." The conversation will be followed by a Q&A. It's part of our Humanities Toolkit series of workshops and resources for carrying humanities scholarship beyond campus.

Subject: Apply to the Out4Undergrad (O4U) Business Conference!

Are you interested in a future career in business (finance, real estate, etc.)? Do you identify as queer (including questioning and those who are not out)? Then the O4U Business Conference is for you! This conference (hosted by Goldman Sachs in New York City) will give you an opportunity to talk to LGBTQ+ professionals from a wide variety of sponsor companies and network and obtain an internship. Apply here: https://outforundergrad.typeform.com/2022O4UBApp<https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Foutforundergrad.typeform.com%2F2022O4UBApp&data=04%7C01%7Cstudent_information%40listserv.pomona.edu%7Cc90e834c01994bc6a9f708d9b368971a%7C817f590439044ee8b3a5a65d4746ff70%7C0%7C0%7C637738084058018969%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=CG3ZI38zlpYS4EKnZQgs%2F2NfQU5nC5zF9oM%2Blu%2FMRw4%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Pomona College - AAMP Impact Committee: Movie Screening

Join the Asian American Mentorship Program (AAMP) Impact Committee for a movie screening on "Persepolis", a 2007 drama/adult cartoon film based on Marjane Satrapi's graphic novel about her life in pre and post-revolutionary Iran and then in Europe. The film will cover themes on growth from childhood to adulthood, rebellion, politics in Iran in the 70-80s, war, and family.

Date/Time: December 5th (Sunday) 3-5pm
Snacks & boba will be provided! :)

Subject: The Humanities Studio Presents: Writing for General-Interest Magazines

Tues, Nov 30 | 4:30pm | The Benton Museum Pavilion

Pomona students are invited to join us as we welcome Lenika Cruz, senior editor of culture at "The Atlantic," to discuss writing, pitching a story, working with an editor, and other insider tips for publishing with public-facing outlets such as "The Atlantic" and "The New Yorker." The conversation will be followed by a Q&A. It's part of our Humanities Toolkit series of workshops and resources for carrying humanities scholarship beyond campus.

Subject: Houselessness and Hunger Initiatives (HHI) - Film Screening: Streetwise (1984) - Night 2

Join HHI for a second screening of the critically acclaimed documentary, Streetwise (1984). Born from a Life magazine expos√© on what was believed to be the ""most livable city in America'' in the 1980s, the film follows the perspective of youth in Seattle to capture a deeply intimate portrait of houselessness that resonates to this day. Snacks and beverages will be provided!

*While not graphic, the film addresses sensitive topics that viewers may find uncomfortable and/or triggering. Email FMI
